main event: Two round flares, the size of a baseball, were observed in Newark Valley, New York in 1952. No aircraft were visually observed, but sound was heard, and the observation lasted for approximately 20 minutes.
interesting points: The report mentions that flares were dropped from an aircraft, indicating a possible prosaic explanation for the observed objects.
There were multiple witnesses, including a civilian and a Lieutenant from the US Air Force, providing some credibility to the observation.
No photographs or physical evidence were obtained during the observation.
The reported altitude of the observed lights was quite high, between 35,000 and 75,000 feet.
The speed of the observed lights was reported to be between 800-900 MPH, indicating high velocity.
